results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: This spreadsheet tracks a meal database for a food service company, managing recipes, nutritional information, dietary attributes, costs, ratings, and operational details for meal planning and production
key_data_points: Calories ranging from 340 to 680 per meal
Multiple recipe versions (A-F variants) for same meals

entities.name: AL
entities.context: Chef's initials for Korean-Style Shredded Beef, Tomato Caper Salmon recipes

entities.name: MJ
entities.context: Chef's initials for Ginger Sesame Chicken recipe

entities.name: NS
entities.context: Chef's initials for Smoky BBQ Shredded Beef recipe

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Recipe with 6 variants (F00002A-F), all marked as 'Graveyard' status

entities.name: Korean-Style Shredded Beef
entities.context: New recipe (F01924A) with Asian/Korean cuisine

entities.name: Tomato Caper Salmon Power Bowl
entities.context: New recipe (F01928A) with highest cost ($4.17) and calories (680)

entities.name: Ginger Sesame Chicken
entities.context: New recipe (F01932A) with lowest cost ($2.12) and calories (340)

entities.name: Smoky BBQ Shredded Beef
entities.context: New recipe (F01941A) with highest fiber content (10g)

insights: Multiple recipe variants exist for the same meal (A-F versions), suggesting iterative recipe development and testing
Chicken & Mushroom Marsala has 6 variants all in 'Graveyard' status, indicating discontinued or archived recipes
Newer recipes (F01900+ range) are marked as 'New' or 'Pending' with approval dates in late 2025
Strong focus on dietary attributes: tracks 16+ dietary categories including Keto, Calorie Smart, High Protein, Dairy Free, GLP-1 Balance
Protein types are highly categorized (Chicken-Breast/Diced, Beef-Shredded, Salmon-Filet, Turkey-Sliced)
Cuisine tracking includes primary and secondary classifications (European-Italian, Asian-Korean, North American-Southwestern)
Cost management is critical: actual costs tracked against max meal costs, with margins varying significantly
Salmon recipe has highest cost ($4.17) and highest nutrition score (4.0), suggesting premium positioning
Color-coded sleeve system (Yellow, Red, Blue) likely for operational/packaging purposes
Complex preparation methods tracked: marinades, grilling, braising, sous vide, with specific equipment noted

results.purpose: Recipe development brainstorming and planning tracker for culinary strategy, tracking new meal concepts across different product lines and dietary preferences
key_data_points: Protein types: Chicken (shredded/breast), Seafood (Sea Bass), Beef & Pork (Meatball)
Product lines: Add On, Gourmet+, GLP-1 Support, Calorie Smart

entities.name: NS
entities.context: Chef assigned to Add On grain bowl projects

entities.name: LH
entities.context: Chef assigned to Gourmet+ (Sea Bass) and GLP-1 Support (Meatball) projects

entities.name: SH
entities.context: Chef potentially assigned to Calorie Smart chicken rework (Steven)

entities.name: Leonard
entities.context: Recommended black rice or wild rice blend for grain bowls

entities.name: Tricia / Abby
entities.context: Confirming if Pesto Cream Chicken & Rice needs rework

entities.name: Add-ons team
entities.context: Requesting grain bowl variety with new rice bases beyond quinoa

entities.name: Chopt Salad
entities.context: Inspiration source - Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad

entities.name: Chipotle
entities.context: Inspiration for Chipotle Crema in Mexican grain bowl

insights: Focus on grain bowl diversification - moving beyond quinoa to include black rice, wild rice blends, and rice/quinoa combinations
Strong emphasis on Asian-inspired flavors with Korean cuisine and Asian street food trending (32% YoY increase in consumer interest)
Multiple dietary guardrails being tracked: Protein Plus, Mediterranean Diet, GLP-1 Support, Calorie Smart, Eat Like an Athlete
Bento-style 1-count packaging preferred for grain bowls, avoiding desserts
Shelf life considerations driving ingredient choices (e.g., avoiding cheese in Mexican bowl)
Strategic protein planning: intention to convert beef/pork meatballs to turkey when spec is available
Recipe concepts typically developed in sets of 3-4 variations per project direction
Cold consumption requirement for grain bowls (rice must be enjoyable eaten cold)
Heavy use of modified marinades (#3, #6, #7) suggesting standardized flavor systems

results.purpose: Track sprint progress, capacity planning, and team velocity for an engineering team working on product features and technical improvements
key_data_points: Team capacity ranges from 31-50 engineer days per sprint
Commitment typically 36-85 story points per sprint
Work allocation: 8 SPs for KTLO, 25% tech tickets, 50% main priorities, 25% QWs
Average velocity over last 3 weeks: 1.80 (most recent)
Team size: 7-8 engineers including EM and SE roles

entities.name: Andrea
entities.context: Team member appearing in all sprints

entities.name: Ahmed
entities.context: Engineering Manager (EM) at 50% capacity

entities.name: Oliver
entities.context: Software Engineer (SE) with reduced availability (days-1)

entities.name: Guhan
entities.context: Team member/engineer

entities.name: Mateusz
entities.context: Team member/engineer

entities.name: Suzi
entities.context: Team member/engineer

entities.name: Desi
entities.context: Team member/engineer

entities.name: Claudia
entities.context: Team member/engineer

entities.name: Shujath
entities.context: Team member in earlier sprints

entities.name: Project Heaven
entities.context: Sprint goal for W45-46

entities.name: iAdvize chatbot
entities.context: Launched in W37-38

entities.name: Wunderkind
entities.context: Email integration work in W35-36

entities.name: UPM
entities.context: Universal Payment Method - multiple sprints

entities.name: Topper
entities.context: Migration completed in Q1 W13-14

insights: Recent velocity improvement: Q4 2025 shows higher velocity (1.58-2.00) compared to Q1 2025 (1.06-1.53)
Pricing API work is a recurring theme across multiple sprints (W43-52), indicating a major ongoing initiative
Team capacity fluctuates significantly (31-50 engineer days), suggesting variable availability or team composition changes
Oliver consistently has reduced availability (days-1 or SE role notation)
Ahmed (EM) is consistently at 50% capacity across all sprints
Sprint goals show focus on pricing systems, user experience features (calorie adjustment, portion percentages), and technical migrations
Most recent sprint (W49-52) achieved highest velocity of 2.00 with 72 story points done
Work distribution formula appears consistent: fixed 8 SPs for KTLO + percentage-based allocation for other work types
Several sprints have incomplete or FALSE sprint goals, indicating challenges in meeting commitments
Team transitioned from working on topper migration and portion features (Q1) to pricing APIs and breed-specific features (Q4)

results.purpose: Tracks the percentage of operational overhead (KTLO - Keep The Lights On work) per month for New Ventures teams
key_data_points: Percentage of operational overhead per month

entities.name: New Ventures
entities.context: Parent organization/project containing multiple teams being tracked

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Ticketing system used as data source for tracking KTLO work

entities.name: KTLO
entities.context: Label used to categorize Keep The Lights On operational work in Jira

insights: Each team has a dedicated tab for tracking their specific operational overhead
Automated nightly cron job updates the spreadsheet, reducing manual effort
System uses resolved date to categorize tickets into specific months
Requires discipline in labeling (KTLO tag) and story point assignment for accuracy
Story points should be added retrospectively for accurate overhead calculation
Tracks ratio of maintenance work vs feature/project work through KTLO percentage

results.purpose: Tracks marketing voucher codes for free product promotions at Good Chop, a meat/food delivery service, mapping promo codes to SKU indexes and customer IDs
key_data_points: 14 different product voucher types (bacon, wings, beef, salmon, steaks, cheesecake)
Two duration types: 'For Life' and 'For Year' promotions
Multiple promo code campaigns: TURKEY, TRK, TRKXA series, GBL
ODL (Order Detail Line) integration for customer tracking

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Food delivery company offering meat and seafood subscriptions with promotional vouchers

entities.name: ODL (Order Detail Line)
entities.context: System used to add customer IDs and track voucher redemptions

entities.name: TURKEY campaigns
entities.context: Multiple turkey-related promotional campaigns (ORGANIC TURKEY, TURKEY ACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY REACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY CODE 2023)

insights: Premium products (ribeyes, filet mignon) are offered as both lifetime and annual promotions, suggesting high-value customer acquisition strategy
Turkey promotions appear to be a major campaign focus with multiple variants (activation, reactivation, organic)
Voucher prefixes follow a pattern: 3-letter codes indicating product type and duration (e.g., BFY=Bacon For Year, RFL=Ribeyes For Life)
Most products are marked as 'Actives email banner: TRUE', indicating active email marketing campaigns
Products emphasize quality attributes: ABF (Antibiotic-Free), Grass Fed, Wild-Caught, Domestic sourcing
The TRKXA series appears to be a systematic campaign with sequential codes (TRKXA1A, TRKXA1B, etc.) tied to SKU index 60
Customer ID list suggests significant scale of promotional distribution (100+ customers tracked)

results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: This spreadsheet tracks a meal database for a food service company, managing recipes, nutritional information, dietary classifications, costs, ratings, and operational details for meal preparation and delivery
key_data_points: Recipe IDs and meal names with descriptors
Cost metrics: meal costs ranging from $1.94 to $4.17, max meal costs from $2.54 to $4.85
Nutritional data: calories (340-680), protein (12-41g), sodium (610-1080mg), carbs (17-54g)
Performance ratings: L3 Run Ratings (0.60%-1.01%), Nutrition Scores (3.25-4.125)
Dietary classifications: Calorie Smart, Chef's Choice, High Protein, Dairy Free, Keto, GLP-1 Balance, etc.
Operational details: cook methods, container types, sleeve colors, preparation times

entities.name: AL
entities.context: Chef's initials for Korean-Style Shredded Beef, Tomato Caper Salmon recipes

entities.name: MJ
entities.context: Chef's initials for Ginger Sesame Chicken recipe

entities.name: NS
entities.context: Chef's initials for Smoky BBQ Shredded Beef recipe

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Multiple recipe variations (F00002A-F) in Graveyard status with European/Italian cuisine

entities.name: Korean-Style Shredded Beef
entities.context: New status meal with Asian/Korean cuisine, 3.40 rating

entities.name: Tomato Caper Salmon Power Bowl
entities.context: New status meal with highest rating (3.51) and cost ($4.17), Mediterranean-friendly

entities.name: Ginger Sesame Chicken
entities.context: New status meal with lowest rating (3.29) and cost ($2.12)

entities.name: Smoky BBQ Shredded Beef
entities.context: New status meal with North American/Midwestern cuisine

insights: Multiple recipe variations exist for the same meal (Chicken & Mushroom Marsala has 6 versions: F00002A-F), all marked as 'Graveyard' status suggesting discontinued items
Newer meals (status: 'New') show approval dates in late 2025 (October-November), indicating active development pipeline
Salmon-based meals have significantly higher costs ($4.17) compared to chicken ($2.12) and beef ($2.82-$2.87) options
Most meals are designed for multiple dietary preferences: High Protein, Dairy Free, Pork Free, and Calorie Smart are common classifications
GLP-1 Balance and GLP-1 Support categories suggest targeting customers using GLP-1 medications for weight management
Protein types vary: Chicken (Breast, Diced), Beef (Shredded), Salmon (Filet), Turkey (Sliced)
Cuisine diversity spans European (Italian, Greek), Asian (Korean, Chinese), and North American (Southwestern, Midwestern)
Container and sleeve color coding system exists (Yellow, Red, Blue) likely for operational/sorting purposes
Fiber content ranges significantly (5-14g), with the Salmon Power Bowl having highest fiber (14g)
All new meals show L3 Run Ratings between 0.74%-1.01%, suggesting recent performance testing

results.purpose: Internal marketing performance tracker for Good Chop, monitoring weekly metrics and campaigns
key_data_points: Spans approximately 3+ years of marketing data (2021-2024)

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Company being tracked; likely a food/meal delivery service based on name

entities.name: Self-Improvement
entities.context: Marketing campaign or category with $1,053 budget allocation and 1 conversion/unit

insights: Long-term tracking system covering 3+ years of weekly marketing data
WoW (Week-over-Week) analysis implemented starting in late 2022, suggesting increased focus on performance monitoring
Sparse data visible in extract suggests this is a large spreadsheet with most cells empty or containing detailed metrics not shown
Self-Improvement campaign data point suggests tracking of campaign-specific performance with budget and conversion metrics
Consistent weekly cadence indicates regular marketing reporting and analysis structure

results.purpose: Tracks marketing voucher codes for free product promotions at Good Chop, a meat/food delivery service, mapping promo codes to SKU indexes and customer IDs
key_data_points: 14 different product voucher types (bacon, wings, beef, salmon, steaks, cheesecake)
Two duration types: 'For Life' and 'For Year' promotions
Multiple promo code campaigns: TURKEY, TRK, TRKXA series, GBL
ODL (Order Detail Line) integration for customer tracking

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat and food subscription/delivery service offering promotional vouchers

entities.name: Turkey Campaign Codes
entities.context: Multiple turkey-related promo codes (ORGANIC TURKEY, TURKEY ACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY REACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY CODE 2023) offering free whole turkeys

entities.name: ODL (Order Detail Line)
entities.context: System integration for adding customer IDs and tracking voucher redemptions

insights: Premium products (ribeyes, filet mignon, NY strip) are offered as both lifetime and yearly promotions, suggesting high-value customer acquisition strategy
Turkey promotions appear to be a major campaign with multiple activation/reactivation codes and extensive customer ID tracking
SKU index 145 is heavily used across multiple TURKEY promo codes, indicating a specific product configuration for turkey promotions
The spreadsheet contains 60+ customer IDs in a separate column, likely representing a batch of customers receiving vouchers
Email banner activation is tracked, with most products set to TRUE except Filet Mignon 'For Life' and NY Strip 'For Life' promotions
Product mix spans proteins (beef, chicken, salmon, turkey) and dessert (cheesecake), indicating diverse promotional strategy
Prefix codes (BCN, BFY, WNG, etc.) provide shorthand identification for voucher types
